keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Mr. Duterte boasted of killing criminals when he was mayor of Davao, and investigators say they have evidence of government-linked death squads.

headline.print_headline: Incoming Philippine Leader’s Vigilante Boasts Send Chill
headline.main: Rodrigo Duterte’s Talk of Killing Criminals Raises Fears in Philippines

snippet: Mr. Duterte boasted of killing criminals when he was mayor of Davao, and investigators say they have evidence of government-linked death squads.
abstract: Davao City, Philippines, Mayor Rodrigo Duterte's promise to kill 100,000 criminals in his first six months in office if elected president has raised alarm in light of evidence of extrajudicial killings by government-sanctioned death squads during his time as mayor; Davao police deny existence of squads, while Duterte's supporters say his policies have greatly improved safety; Duterte, who won election, is scheduled to take office in June.
